16 def reject_outliers(data, m=1):
17  """
18  Rejects one outlier.
19 
20  Arguments
21  ---------
22  `data`: `np.array`
23  The data
24 
25  `m`: `int`
26  The number of standard deviations from the mean to
27  reject data points.
28 
29  """
30  is_in_std = np.all(np.absolute(data - np.mean(data, axis=0)) < m * np.std(data, axis=0), axis=1)
31  return data[is_in_std, :]
32 
33 
34 def reject_outlier(data, m=1):
35  """
36  Rejects one outlier.
37 
38  Arguments
39  ---------
40  `data`: `np.array`
41  The data
42 
43  `m`: `int`
44  The number of standard deviations from the mean to
45  reject data points.
46  """
47  is_in_std = np.absolute(data - np.mean(data)) < m * np.std(data)
48  return data[is_in_std, :]

51 class StaticPoseData():
52  """
53  Class to store static poses into a nested dictionary.
54  It is stored as in [20 poses][7 IMUs][data].
55  self.data[pose_name][imu_name] = np.ndarray
56  The data is defined as below.
57  data = [mean x y z acceleration].
58  so the np.ndarray's dimension is (No. of collected data
59  x xyz accelerations)
60  """
61  def __init__(self, pose_names, imu_names, filepath):
62  """
63  Initialize StaticPoseData class.
64 
65  Arguments
66  ----------
67  pose_names: list[str]
68  Names of poses
69  imu_names: list[str]
70  Names of imus
71  filepath: str
72  Path to save the collected data
73  """
74  self.pose_names = pose_names
75 
76  self.imu_names = imu_names
77  self.filepath = filepath
78  self.data = OrderedDict()
79 
80  # Create nested dictionary to store data
81  for pose_name in pose_names:
82  self.data[pose_name] = OrderedDict()
83  for imu_name in self.imu_names:
84  self.data[pose_name][imu_name] = np.empty((0, 14), float)
85 
86  def append(self, pose_name, imu_name, data):
87  """
88  Append data to a dictionary whose keys are
89  [pose_name][imu_name]
90 
91  Arguments
92  ----------
93  pose_name: str
94  Names of poses
95  imu_name: str
96  Names of imus
97  data: np.array
98  Numpy array of size (1,3).
99  Includes an accelerometer measurement.
100  """
101  self.data[pose_name][imu_name] = \
102  np.append(self.data[pose_name][imu_name], np.array([data]), axis=0)
103 
104  def clean_data(self, verbose=False):
105  """
106  Cleans the data
107 
108  Arguments
109  ---------
110  `verbose`: `bool`
111  """
112  # Create nested dictionary to store data
113  # retrigger
114  data = copy.deepcopy(self.data)
115  for pose_name in self.pose_names:
116  for imu_name in self.imu_names:
117  # 0th IMU is a fake IMU
118  if imu_name == 'imu_link0':
119  quaternion = np.zeros(4)
120  acceleration = np.zeros(3)
121  joint = np.zeros(7)
122  # For other IMUs
123  else:
124  d = self.data[pose_name][imu_name]
125  # Quaternions
126  quaternions = reject_outliers(d[:, :4])
127  quaternion = np.mean(quaternions, axis=0)
128  # Linear Accelerations
129  accelerations = reject_outliers(d[:, 4:7])
130  acceleration = np.mean(accelerations, axis=0)
131  # Joint Angles
132  joints = reject_outliers(d[:, 7:])
133  joint = np.mean(joints, axis=0)
134 
135  data[pose_name][imu_name] = np.r_[quaternion, acceleration, joint]
136 
137  if verbose:
138  rospy.loginfo(
139  '[%s, %s] Mean Acceleration: (%.3f %.3f %.3f)' % (
140  pose_name, imu_name, acceleration[0], acceleration[1], acceleration[2]
141  )
142  )
143 
144  return data
145 
146  def save(self, data):
147  """
148  Save both the original collected data and the averaged data
149 
150  Arguments
151  ---------
152  `data`: `OrderedDict`
153  The data from static data collection, saved to a pickle file.
154  """
155  with open(self.filepath, 'wb') as f:
156  pickle.dump(data, f)
157 
158 
159 class DynamicPoseData():
160  """
161  Class to store dynamic pose data into a nested dictionary.
162  It is stored as in [20 poses][7 excited joints][7 IMUs][data].
163  self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name] = np.ndarray
164  The data is defined as below.
165  data = [max acceleration, theta at the point].
166  """
167  def __init__(self, pose_names, joint_names, imu_names, filepath):
168  """
169  Initialize DynamicPoseData class.
170 
171  Arguments
172  ----------
173  pose_names: list[str]
174  Names of poses
175  joint_names: list[str]
176  Names of joints
177  imu_names: list[str]
178  Names of imus
179  filepath: str
180  Path to save the collected data
181  """
182  self.pose_names = pose_names
183  self.joint_names = joint_names
184  self.imu_names = imu_names
185 
186  self.filepath = filepath
187  self.data = OrderedDict()
188  self.data_shape = (0, 14)
189 
190  # Create nested dictionary to store data
191  for pose_name in pose_names:
192  self.data[pose_name] = OrderedDict()
193  for joint_name in joint_names:
194  self.data[pose_name][joint_name] = OrderedDict()
195  for imu_name in self.imu_names:
196  self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name] = np.empty(self.data_shape, float)
197 
198  def append(self, pose_name, joint_name, imu_name, data):
199  """
200  Append data to a dictionary whose keys are
201  [pose_name][joint_name][imu_name]
202 
203  Arguments
204  ----------
205  pose_name: str
206  Names of poses
207  joint_name: str
208  Names of joints
209  imu_name: str
210  Names of imus
211  data: np.array
212  Numpy array of size (1,4).
213  Includes an accelerometer measurement and a joint angle.
214  """
215  if not isinstance(data, np.ndarray):
216  raise ValueError('"data" must be a np.ndarray')
217 
218  self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name] = \
219  np.append(self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name], np.array([data]), axis=0)
220 
221  def clean_data(self, verbose=False, time_range=(0.04, 0.16),
222  eliminate_outliers=True):
223  """
224  Cleans the data.
225 
226  Arguments
227  ----------
228  `verbose`: `bool`
229  Determines if you want to see plots of the original
230  data vs. the filtered data.
231 
232  `time_range`: `tuple`
233  The time range from which the max acceleration is
234  to be found. For example, (0.04, 0.16) means that
235  the max acceleration value will be searched in between 0.04
236  and 0.16 seconds.
237  """
238  # Create nested dictionary to store data
239  data = copy.deepcopy(self.data)
240  for pose_name in self.pose_names:
241  for joint_name in self.joint_names:
242  for imu_name in self.imu_names:
243  # on each pose, for each joint wiggle, get the
244  # maximum acceleration for each skin unit
245  imu_data = self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name]
246  # filter imu acceleration, angular velocities,
247  # joint accelerations
248  imu_accs = imu_data[:, :3]
249 
250  norms = np.linalg.norm(imu_accs, axis=1)
251  joint_accs = imu_data[:, 11]
252  if eliminate_outliers:
253  # use hampel filter for outlier detection
254  # it actually doesn't affect the end result much.
255  norms = utils.hampel_filter_forloop(norms, 10)[0]
256  joint_accs = utils.hampel_filter_forloop(joint_accs, 10)[0]
257 
258  # filter
259  filtered_norms = utils.low_pass_filter(norms, 100.)
260  filtered_joint_accs = utils.low_pass_filter(joint_accs, 100.)
261 
262  # array of imu data - both filtered and raw
263  imu_filtered_arr = []
264  imu_raw_arr = []
265 
266  # max imu acceleration
267  imu_acc_max = 0
268  # max individual joint acceleration
269  joint_acc_max = 0
270  # idx of the max acceleration.
271  best_idx = 0
272 
273  # go through filtered norms and accelerations
274  for idx, (norm, acc) in enumerate(zip(filtered_norms, filtered_joint_accs)):
275  cur_time = imu_data[idx, 10]
276  # add filtered and raw data to array
277  imu_filtered_arr.append(norm)
278  imu_raw_arr.append(norms[idx])
279  """
280  conditions for update of best idx:
281  - the filtered norm is greater than the current highest one.
282  - the time of this data lies within `time_range`
283  - the filtered joint acceleration is also greater than the current highest one.
284 
285  """
286  if norm > imu_acc_max and cur_time < time_range[1] and cur_time > time_range[0] and acc > joint_acc_max:
287  best_idx = idx
288  imu_acc_max = norm
289  joint_acc_max = acc
290  # update data to the max acceleration point
291  best = self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name][best_idx]
292 
293  self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name] = [best]
294 
295  if verbose:
296  # plots the acceleration norms - filtered and raw
297  plt.plot(imu_raw_arr)
298  plt.plot(imu_filtered_arr)
299  plt.show()
300 
301  rospy.loginfo(data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name])
302 
303  return data
304 
305  def save(self, data):
306  """
307  Saves the data to a pickle file.
308 
309  Arguments
310  ----------
311  `data`: `OrderedDict`
312  The data to be saved
313  """
314  with open(self.filepath, 'wb') as f:
315  pickle.dump(data, f)
